registry.meta:
FORM_TYPEs for Data Forms &LEGALNOTICE; This is the official registry of FORM_TYPEs and associated fields used in the context of the 'jabber:x:data' namespace (see &xep0004; and &xep0068;), as registered with the ®ISTRAR;.
0.9 2009-04-06 psa Added missing jabber:iq:register:cancel and jabber:iq:register:changepassword FORM_TYPEs from XEP-0077.
0.8 2008-09-03 psa Added CAPTCHA form type and CAPTCHA-related fields for registration form type.
0.7 2007-09-27 psa Added pubsub-options form type.
0.6 2007-01-31 psa Added server contact addresses registration from XEP-0157.
0.5 2007-01-17 psa Added chat session negotiation registration from XEP-0155.
0.4 2006-07-05 psa Corrected pubsub registration.
0.3 2006-03-23 psa Added registration from XEP-0146.
0.2 2004-01-18 psa Registrations from XEP-0055 and XEP-0060.
0.1 2003-12-31 psa Initial version (registrations from XEP-0045 and XEP-0077).

form_type.name: http://jabber.org/network/serverinfo
form_type.desc: Forms enabling the communication of contact addresses and other server information.

field.label: One or more addresses for communication related to abusive traffic
One or more addresses for customer feedback
One or more addresses for communication related to sales and marketing
One or more addresses for communication related to security concerns
One or more addresses for customer support

form_type.name: http://jabber.org/protocol/admin
form_type.desc: Forms used for administration of servers and components.

field.label: The Jabber ID of a single entity to which an operation applies
The Jabber ID of one or more entities to which an operation applies
The Jabber IDs associated with active sessions
The number of online entities that are active
A list of entities with administrative privileges
The text of an announcement to be sent to active users or all users
A list of entities with whom communication is blocked
The number of seconds to delay before applying a change
The Jabber IDs that have been disabled
The number of disabled entities
The email address for a user
The given (first) name of a user
The number of online entities that are idle
The IP addresses of an account's online sessions
The last login time (per XEP-0082) of a user
The number of logins per minute for an account
The maximum number of items associated with a search or list
The text of a message of the day
The names of an account's online sessions
The Jabber IDs associated with online users
The number of online entities
The password for an account
Password verification
A list of registered entities
The number of registered entities
Number of roster items for an account
The number of stanzas being sent per second by an account
The family (last) name of a user
The text of a welcome message
A list of entities with whom communication is allowed

form_type.name: http://jabber.org/protocol/muc#register
form_type.desc: Forms enabling user registration with a Multi-User Chat (MUC) room.

field.label: Given Name
Family Name
Desired Nickname
Your URL
Email Address
FAQ Entry

form_type.name: http://jabber.org/protocol/muc#roomconfig
form_type.desc: Forms enabling creation and configuration of a Multi-User Chat (MUC) room.

field.label: Whether to Allow Occupants to Invite Others
Whether to Allow Occupants to Change Subject
Whether to Enable Logging of Room Conversations
Natural Language for Room Discussions
Maximum Number of Room Occupants
Whether an Make Room Members-Only
Whether to Make Room Moderated
Whether a Password is Required to Enter
Whether to Make Room Persistent
Roles for which Presence is Broadcast
Whether to Allow Public Searching for Room
Full List of Room Admins
Short Description of Room
Natural-Language Room Name
Full List of Room Owners
The Room Password
Affiliations that May Discover Real JIDs of Occupants

form_type.name: http://jabber.org/protocol/pubsub#subscribe_authorization
form_type.desc: Forms enabling authorization of subscriptions to pubsub nodes

field.label: Whether to allow the subscription
The SubID of the subscription
The NodeID of the relevant node
The address (JID) of the subscriber

form_type.name: http://jabber.org/protocol/pubsub#subscribe_options
form_type.desc: Forms enabling configuration of subscription options for pubsub nodes

field.label: Whether an entity wants to receive or disable notifications
Whether an entity wants to receive digests (aggregations) of notifications or all notifications individually
The minimum number of milliseconds between sending any two notification digests
The DateTime at which a leased subscription will end or has ended
Whether an entity wants to receive an XMPP message body in addition to the payload format
The presence states for which an entity wants to receive notifications

option.label: XMPP Show Value of Away
XMPP Show Value of Chat
XMPP Show Value of DND (Do Not Disturb)
Mere Availability in XMPP (No Show Value)
XMPP Show Value of XA (Extended Away)
Receive notification of new items only
Receive notification of new nodes only
Receive notification from direct child nodes only
Receive notification from all descendent nodes

form_type.name: http://jabber.org/protocol/pubsub#meta-data
form_type.desc: Forms enabling setting of meta-data information about pubsub nodes

field.label: The JIDs of those to contact with questions
The datetime when the node was created
The JID of the node creator
A description of the node
The default language of the node
The number of subscribers to the node
The JIDs of those with an affiliation of owner
The JIDs of those with an affiliation of publisher
The name of the node
Payload type

form_type.name: http://jabber.org/protocol/pubsub#node_config
form_type.desc: Forms enabling configuration of pubsub nodes

field.label: Who may subscribe and retrieve items

option.label: Subscription requests must be approved and only subscribers may retrieve items
Anyone may subscribe and retrieve items
Anyone with a presence subscription of both or from may subscribe and retrieve items
Anyone in the specified roster group(s) may subscribe and retrieve items
Only those on a whitelist may subscribe and retrieve items

field.label: The URL of an XSL transformation which can be applied to payloads in order to generate an appropriate message body element.
The collection with which a node is affiliated
The JIDs of those to contact with questions
The URL of an XSL transformation which can be applied to the payload format in order to generate a valid Data Forms result that the client could display using a generic Data Forms rendering engine
Whether to deliver event notifications
Whether to deliver payloads with event notifications; applies only to leaf nodes
Whether owners or publisher should receive replies to items

option.label: Statically specify a replyto of the node owner(s)
Dynamically specify a replyto of the item publisher

field.label: Who may associate leaf nodes with a collection

option.label: Anyone may associate leaf nodes with the collection
Only collection node owners may associate leaf nodes with the collection
Only those on a whitelist may associate leaf nodes with the collection

field.label: The list of JIDs that may associate leaf nodes with a collection
The child nodes (leaf or collection) associated with a collection
The maximum number of child nodes that can be associated with a collection
The maximum number of items to persist
The maximum payload size in bytes
Whether the node is a leaf (default) or a collection

option.label: The node is a leaf node (default)
The node is a collection node

field.label: Whether to notify subscribers when the node configuration changes
Whether to notify subscribers when the node is deleted
Whether to notify subscribers when items are removed from the node
Whether to notify owners about new subscribers and unsubscribes
Whether to persist items to storage
Whether to deliver notifications to available users only
The publisher model

option.label: Only publishers may publish
Subscribers may publish
Anyone may publish

field.label: The specific multi-user chat rooms to specify for replyroom
The specific JID(s) to specify for replyto
The roster group(s) allowed to subscribe and retrieve items
When to send the last published item

option.label: Never
When a new subscription is processed
When a new subscription is processed and whenever a subscriber comes online

field.label: Whether to allow subscriptions
A friendly name for the node
The type of node data, usually specified by the namespace of the payload (if any); MAY be list-single rather than text-single

form_type.name: http://jabber.org/protocol/pubsub#publish-options
form_type.desc: Forms enabling publication with options; each field must specify whether it defines METADATA to be attached to the item, a per-item OVERRIDE of the node configuration, or a PRECONDITION to be checked against the node configuration.

field.label: Precondition: node configuration with the specified access model

option.label: Access model of authorize
Access model of open
Access model of presence
Access model of roster
Access model of whitelist

form_type.name: http://jabber.org/protocol/rc
form_type.desc: Forms used for remote controlling clients

field.label: Whether to automatically authorize subscription requests
Whether to automatically accept file transfers
Whether to automatically open new messages
Whether to automatically go offline when idle
Whether to play sounds
A list of pending file transfers
A list of joined groupchat rooms
A presence or availability status

option.label: Chat
Online
Away
Extended Away
Do Not Disturb
Invisible
Offline

field.label: The status message text
The new priority for the client

form_type.name: jabber:iq:register
form_type.desc: Standardization of fields related to in-band registration.

field.label: Street portion of a physical or mailing address
number of answers required
text associated with a sound
challenge ID
Locality portion of a physical or mailing address
Email address of the user
Given name of the user
Family name of the user
Full name of the user
Familiar name of the user
code appearing in an image
Password or secret for the user
answer associated with a picture
text associated with a picture
answer to a question
least significant bits of SHA-256 hash of text should equal hexadecimal label
stanza ID
answer associated with speech
text associated with speech
Region portion of a physical or mailing address
Account name associated with the user
answer associated with a video
text associated with a video
Postal code portion of a physical or mailing address

form_type.name: jabber:iq:register:cancel
form_type.desc: Standardization of fields related to cancellation use case.

field.label: Password or secret for the user
Account name associated with the user

form_type.name: jabber:iq:register:changepassword
form_type.desc: Standardization of fields related to change password use case.

field.label: Old password for the user
Desired password for the user
Account name associated with the user
Given Name
Family Name
Nickname
Email Address

form_type.name: urn:xmpp:captcha
form_type.desc: Forms enabling the use of CAPTCHAs.

field.label: number of answers required
text associated with a sound
challenge ID
to attribute of stanza that triggered challenge
code appearing in an image
answer associated with a picture
text associated with a picture
answer to a question
least significant bits of SHA-256 hash of text should equal hexadecimal label
stanza ID
answer associated with speech
text associated with speech
answer associated with a video
text associated with a video

form_type.name: urn:xmpp:ssn
form_type.desc: Forms enabling negotation of a one-to-one chat session between two entities.

field.label: Whether to accept the invitation
Another resource with which to continue the session
Disclosure of content, decryption keys or identities

option.label: Entities guarantee no disclosure features exist (not even disabled features)
Entities MUST NOT disclose (except for those disclosures that are required by law)
Entities MAY disclose

field.label: Whether may send Chat State Notifications per XEP-0085

option.label: May Send
Must Not Send

field.label: Whether allowed to use XHTML-IM formatting per XEP-0071

option.label: May Send
Must Not Send

field.label: Primary written language of the chat (each value appears in order of preference and conforms to RFC 4646 and the IANA registry)
Whether allowed to log messages (i.e., whether Off-The-Record mode is required)

option.label: Allow Message Logging
Disallow All Message Logging (i.e., must disable absolutely all message logging including automatic archiving -- see XEP-0136

field.label: Whether to renegotiate the session
Minimum security level

option.label: Secure connections not required
Both parties must be securely connected to their servers
Both parties must be securely connected to each other

field.label: Whether to terminate the session
Whether to enable Message Receipts per XEP-0184
